p: Angiopoietin-like 4 (ANGPTL4) is a soluble angiogenic-regulating protein. Following proteolytic cleavage, the C-terminal portion (cANGPTL4) is involved in integrin-dependent wound repair and can regulate vascular permeability ( 35, 36). ANGPTL4 was significantly elevated in lung biopsies from IAV-induced pneumonia patients ( 16). In mouse studies, neutralizing anti-ANGPTL4 Abs reduced pulmonary tissue leakiness significantly accelerating lung recovery and improved lung tissue integrity ( 16).
